Are you up to attempting to debug the problem so we can figure out the issue?
We can set the Ant build to be debuggable to figure out what is failing and where.

If you set the following to be vm arguments for the separate JRE build:
-Xdebug -Xnoagent -Djava.compiler=NONE -Xrunjdwp:transport=dt_socket,server=y,suspend=y,address=8000

the Ant build execution will wait until a debugger connects to it.

You would need to import the org.apache.ant plugin into your workspace and set a breakpoint in the Get.execute() method before initiating the build.

Then to connect the Eclipse debugger to the build:
Run>Debug...>Remote Java Application
Click the New button
(Defaults should be good)
Click Debug

It looks like it hangs on Inet4AddressImpl.lookupAllHostAddr(String). This is called indirectly by HttpURLConnection.connect(). (I'll include a picture of the stack trace).

I've noticed that all the forked threads are still active at this point. They are not active when it is run in the same workspace JRE.

My guess is that there are problems with the fork not being cleaned up correctly and connect() is waiting on a locked resource.

Let me know if there is any other info or debugging I can provide that would be helpful.
